elements.title: Maria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Queen Maria of Jerusalem died while giving birth to Queen Isabella II (pictured), who died while giving birth?

elements.title: Al Sheehan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Al Sheehan, despite being WCCO's expert on contract bridge, did not know "a trump from a rubber"?

elements.title: Spanish fennel flower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that chloroform extracts from the seeds of the Spanish fennel flower have exhibited anti-inflammatory properties?

elements.title: Sabine Kirchmeier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sabine Kirchmeier reported her mayor to the police as a local politician, and then became the first director of the Danish Language Council?

elements.title: sound recordings were not copyrighted (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sound recordings were not copyrighted under United States law until 1972?

elements.title: Leik Myrabo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leik Myrabo invented a laser-propelled type of spacecraft?

elements.title: premiere of the second season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the premiere of the second season of Arrested Development required David Cross to paint himself blue, taking up to three showers a day to remove the paint?

elements.title: safety reasons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Formula One drivers are required to wear fire-resistant underwear for safety reasons?

elements.title: Burger Continental (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Burger Continental served dishes like "Chicken Erotica" to jurors in high-profile cases, including the trials of O. J. Simpson and the Menendez brothers?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
